valueFormat.notes: Controls drawer visibility. When true, drawer is open/visible. When false, drawer is closed/hidden. Use v-model:status for two-way binding to reactively control drawer state.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show drawer
false // Hide drawer

commonMistakes.mistake: Not using v-model:status for two-way binding
commonMistakes.why: Drawer needs to sync state when user closes it (via X button or outside click)
commonMistakes.impact: Drawer can't be reopened after user closes it, state out of sync
commonMistakes.fix: Use v-model:status instead of :status for two-way binding

valueFormat.notes: Drawer width. Required prop. 'small' (~400px), 'medium' (~600px), 'large' (~800px). Choose based on content complexity - use small for simple forms, large for complex multi-column layouts.
valueFormat.example:
'small' // ~400px - Quick forms, filters
'medium' // ~600px - Standard forms, details
'large' // ~800px - Complex forms, multi-column

possibleValues.description: ~400px width - Quick forms, filters, simple content

valueFormat.notes: Drawer header title. Required prop. Keep concise (2-5 words). Describes drawer purpose/content. Shown in header alongside close button.
Visual state affecting header color. 'default' (neutral), 'danger' (red - for destructive actions), 'warning' (orange - for caution). Use to indicate drawer intent.
valueFormat.example:
'default' // Neutral drawer
'danger' // Delete confirmation, destructive action
'warning' // Warning, caution required

valueFormat.notes: Optional subtitle/description shown below title in header. Provides additional context about drawer purpose. Keep to 1-2 sentences.
valueFormat.example:
'Edit campaign settings and schedule'
'View and manage user permissions'
'Configure advanced filter criteria'

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows descriptionText below title. Set false to hide description even if descriptionText is provided.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show description (default)
false // Hide description

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows X close button in header. Set false to force user to use footer buttons (for critical workflows requiring confirmation).
valueFormat.example:
true // Show close button (default)
false // Hide close button (force footer actions)

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), clicking overlay (outside drawer) closes drawer. Set false for critical workflows where accidental closure should be prevented.
valueFormat.example:
true // Click outside to close (default)
false // Prevent outside click close

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows dark overlay behind drawer. Set false for non-modal drawers that allow interaction with background content.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show overlay (default, modal)
false // No overlay (non-modal)

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows footer with action buttons. Set false to hide footer for read-only/info drawers.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show footer with buttons (default)
false // Hide footer (info/read-only drawer)

valueFormat.notes: Configuration for footer action buttons. Defines button labels, variants, and click handlers. Common patterns: Cancel + Save, Close, Back + Next.
When true, content area has no padding, allowing full-width components (tables, images). Default false adds standard padding.
valueFormat.example:
true // No padding, full width
false // Standard padding (default)

onCloseEvent.description: Emitted when drawer is closed (via close button, outside click, or ESC key)
onCloseEvent.when: User closes drawer by any method. Use to cleanup state, reset forms, or trigger side effects on close.

basicDrawer.title: Basic Drawer with Form
basicDrawer.description: Simple drawer with form and action buttons
basicDrawer.code:
<template>
  <InDrawer
    v-model:status="showDrawer"
    size="medium"
    titleText="Edit Campaign"
    descriptionText="Update campaign settings"
    :footerButtonGroupOptions="{
      primaryButton: { text: 'Save', onClick: handleSave, loading: isSaving },
      secondaryButton: { text: 'Cancel', onClick: () => showDrawer = false }
    }"
    @onCloseEvent="handleClose"
  >
    <template #contentSlot>
      <InBasicTextInput v-model="form.name" label="Campaign Name" />
      <InTextArea v-model="form.description" label="Description" />
    </template>
  </InDrawer>
</template>

<script setup>
const showDrawer = ref(false);
const isSaving = ref(false);
const form = ref({ name: '', description: '' });

const handleSave = async () => {
  isSaving.value = true;
  await api.updateCampaign(form.value);
  isSaving.value = false;
  showDrawer.value = false;
};

const handleClose = () => {
  // Reset form on close
  form.value = { name: '', description: '' };
};
</script>

implementationPatterns.name: Form Drawer Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Use drawer for forms that don't require full page, with save/cancel actions
implementationPatterns.code:
<InDrawer
  v-model:status="showForm"
  size="medium"
  titleText="Edit Item"
  :footerButtonGroupOptions="{
    primaryButton: { text: 'Save', onClick: save, loading: isSaving },
    secondaryButton: { text: 'Cancel', onClick: () => showForm = false }
  }"
>
  <template #contentSlot>
    <form @submit.prevent="save">
      <!-- Form fields -->
    </form>
  </template>
</InDrawer>
implementationPatterns.when: Editing items, creating new entities, updating settings - any form that doesn't need full page context
cons: Can't see related data while editing

bestPractices.title: Use v-model:status for Two-Way Binding
bestPractices.description: Always use v-model:status to sync drawer state when user closes it
bestPractices.reasoning: v-model handles close event automatically. Using :status without v-model breaks re-opening after user closes drawer.

bestPractices.title: Choose Appropriate Size for Content
bestPractices.description: Match drawer size to content complexity
bestPractices.reasoning: Too small = cramped content. Too large = wasted space. Choose size that fits content comfortably.

bestPractices.title: Use Danger State for Destructive Actions
bestPractices.reasoning: Red header warns users of destructive action. Disabling outside click prevents accidental deletion.

bestPractices.title: Disable Close for Critical Workflows
bestPractices.description: Prevent accidental closure during important processes
bestPractices.reasoning: Critical workflows (payments, multi-step forms) shouldn't be accidentally closed. Force users to use Cancel button.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not using v-model:status for two-way binding
commonMistakes.why: Drawer needs to sync state when user closes it
commonMistakes.impact: Critical - drawer can't be reopened after user closes it

commonMistakes.mistake: Using large drawer for simple content

commonMistakes.why: Form data or state persists between opens
commonMistakes.impact: Old data shows when drawer reopens

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing outside click close for critical actions
commonMistakes.why: Users can accidentally close during important workflows

performanceNotes.description: Don't render drawer content until drawer is opened
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use v-if on InDrawer or lazy load heavy content inside drawer. Prevents rendering unused components.
performanceNotes.impact: Medium: Saves initial render time, especially with multiple drawers

performanceNotes.description: Clear heavy data structures when drawer closes
performanceNotes.recommendation: In onCloseEvent handler, clear large datasets, cancel pending requests, reset computed values.
performanceNotes.impact: Low: Prevents memory leaks in long-running sessions

accessibilityNotes.description: Focus should move to drawer when opened, return to trigger when closed
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: When drawer opens, focus first interactive element (close button or first input). When closes, return focus to button that opened it.

accessibilityNotes.description: Drawer should support ESC key to close and trap focus
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: ESC key should close drawer (unless closeButtonStatus=false for critical flow). Tab key should cycle through drawer elements only, not background.

accessibilityNotes.description: Drawer should have appropriate ARIA role and labels
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Drawer should have role='dialog' and aria-label matching titleText. Overlay should have aria-hidden='true'.

accessibilityNotes.description: Opening drawer should announce to screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use aria-live region or focus management to announce drawer opening to screen reader users.
